properties.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 8 at 7:22AM CST until February 9 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Nashville TN
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a Flood Advisory for the
following rivers in Middle Tennessee...

Buffalo River Near Lobelville affecting Perry County

. The Buffalo River near Lobelville has dropped below flood stage but remains above
action stage therefore a flood advisory is in place. Today and Sunday will be dry,
but more heavy rain is possible starting on Monday. This could lead to additional
rises on the Buffalo River.

The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a
* Flood Advisory for
The Buffalo River Near Lobelville
* At 06AM Saturday the stage was 13.2 feet and falling.
* Action stage is 10.0 feet.
* Flood stage is 14.0 feet.
* The river will continue to fall to near 8.8 feet by tomorrow morning.
* At 14.0 feet...Gilmer Bridge Rd and Russell Creek Rd begin to flood. Leeper
Bottom and Qualls Bend Rd become flooded as well. Water approaches portions of
Highway 438 south of Lobelville near Beardstown.
* At 12.0 feet...Portions of secondary roads near Old Highway 13 are inundated.
* At 10.0 feet...Water inundates low lying areas and agricultural land along the
river.
properties.instruction:
Stay tuned to NOAA weather radio or other local media for further information
from the National Weather Service.
